meanings.definition: The act of selling goods or services by telephone.
meanings.sent1: Telemarking can be an effective way to reach customers who prefer phone communication.
meanings.sent2: I did some telemarking for the new product launch and managed to secure a few sales.
meanings.sent3: The telemarking team had a competition to see who could make the most sales calls in an hour.
meanings.sent4: Her telemarking skills were so good, she could sell ice to an Eskimo over the phone.
meanings.sent5: The telemarking campaign was so successful that the phone lines were constantly busy.

meanings.definition: The act of making a turn in skiing by shifting weight from one ski to the other.
meanings.sent1: During the lesson, we practiced telemarking to improve our skiing technique.
meanings.sent2: Telemarking requires good balance and coordination to execute the turn smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The telemarking instructor showed us how to gracefully shift our weight while skiing.
meanings.sent4: She glided down the slope with the elegance of a swan while telemarking.
meanings.sent5: The telemarking competition showcased the skiers' agility and control on the slopes.
